verb.description: To confuse, perplex, bewilder; to exhaust, overcome, stupefy; (occasionally) to pester. Chiefly refl. or in pass.
To be delirious, to babble; to wander about aimlessly, ramble.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Abraham Fraunce (?1559–?1593), poet and lawyer. Origin uncertain; perhaps from Irish modartha dark, murky, morose (Early Irish modarda sullen, sad), of uncertain origin.
